competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
General
Identify Florida’s seventeen career clusters.
List Florida’s seventeen career clusters.
Research the national career clusters website: http://www.careertech.org/.
Identify the Career and Technical Student Organizations (CTSO) appropriate for Career and Technical Education (CTE) programs.
Explain the purpose of a Career and Technical Student Organization (CTSO).
Demonstrate leadership skills.
Identify roles and responsibilities of members of professional and community service organizations, including career and technical student organizations (CTSO).
Work cooperatively as a group member to demonstrate leadership and achieve organizational goals.
Demonstrate leadership roles and organizational responsibilities.
Identify and utilize the planning process.
Develop a personal growth project.
Identify leadership roles and organizational responsibilities.
Research and discuss the history of the related career and technical student organization (CTSO).
Demonstrate leadership skills needed to develop a positive work environment.
Apply appropriate strategies to manage conflict in work situations.
Identify and utilize the Family, Career and Community Leaders of America (FCCLA) planning process.
Develop a personal portfolio project.
Identify purposes and functions of professional and community service organizations.
Discuss the establishment and history of the Family, Career and Community Leaders of America (FCCLA) organization.
Explore emerging workplace trends and issues.
Describe current trends and issues that impact global and local business environments.
Demonstrate skills for success.
Identify different types of professional and community service organizations, including career and technical student organizations that relate to the child and education.
Identify roles and responsibilities of members of professional and community service organizations, including career and technical student organizations.
Develop human relationship skills such as a positive work ethic, positive attitudes towards others, and manners in the workplace.
Identify and utilize the planning process to accomplish personal and professional goals.
Demonstrate knowledge, skill, and application of information systems to accomplish job objectives and enhance workplace performance.
Develop keyboarding skills to enter and manipulate text and data.
Describe and use current and emerging computer technology and software to perform personal and business related tasks.
Identify and describe communications and networking systems used in workplace environments.
Use reference materials such as online help, vendor bulletin boards, tutorials, and manuals available for application software.
Describe ethical issues related to computers and information systems.
Demonstrate basic file management skills.
Troubleshoot problems with computer software, hardware, peripherals, and other office equipment.
Select and use standard written business and financial communication formats.
Demonstrate leadership, study, and organizational skills.
Identify purposes and functions of professional and community service organizations.
Identify roles and responsibilities of members of professional and community service organizations, including career and technical student organizations.
Work cooperatively as a group member to achieve organizational goals.
Demonstrate confidence in leadership roles and organizational responsibilities.
Demonstrate personal responsibility.
Practice time management techniques.
Identify methods used for studying.
List ways to use study time wisely.
Create a plan to manage your time.
List ways technology can add balance to your life.
Develop a personal growth project.
Identify ways to create organization in your personal space.
Apply academic skills as they relate to the workplace.
Demonstrate reading comprehension of technical and work manuals and written instruction.
Apply appropriate mathematical skills as they relate to the task at hand.
Apply technical writing skills.
Use safe work practices.
Comply with all applicable basic Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) rules and regulations.
Use appropriate safety equipment.
Describe personal and jobsite safety rules and regulations that maintain safe and healthy work environments and work ethics.
Identify and apply effective communication skills.
Describe why communication is the basis for all relationships.
Describe the ways communication forms the basis for all relationships.
Select and use appropriate modes of communication, including the Internet, for specific workplace situations.
Demonstrate ability to follow written and oral directions.
Use listening, speaking, and non-verbal skills and strategies to communicate effectively.
Distinguish between different forms of communication (e.g. assertive, passive, aggressive, etc.).
Use presentation software to enhance communication skills.
Demonstrate verbal and non-verbal communication skills.
Demonstrate the ability to function as an effective team member.
Identify the impact of non-verbal behavior on communication.
Organize ideas and communicate oral and written messages appropriately.
Demonstrate communication skills that promote positive relationships in the workplace.
Produce electronic publications using digital publishing software.
Demonstrate communication skills that promote positive relationships with children.
Identify employability skills necessary to obtain a job.
Demonstrate personal and professional etiquette.
Discuss the importance of accepting constructive criticism.
Collaborate with individuals and teams to complete tasks and solve problems.
Practice active listening skills.
Define and explain appropriate discipline and guidance procedures for children.
Demonstrate an understanding of how computers and other technologies are used as a communication tool.
Demonstrate techniques for dealing with criticism.
Demonstrate an awareness of project management concepts and tools (e.g. timelines, deadlines, resource allocation, time management, delegation of tasks, collaboration).
Demonstrate conflict resolution skills.
Identify and use industry-specific terminology and abbreviations.
Demonstrate computer literacy.
Practice appropriate written and verbal communication necessary for the workplace.
Practice effective presentation techniques.
Identify appropriate conversation for the work environment.
Analyze careers in the related industry.
Describe careers in the design industry.
Describe careers in the audio visual technology, film, and printing technology industries.
Describe available careers in education.
Describe careers in the culinary and hospitality industry.
Classify careers from entry level to professional level.
Explore entrepreneurship opportunities in the design industry.
Explore entrepreneurship opportunities in the audio visual technology, film, and printing technology industries.
Explore entrepreneurship opportunities in the field of education.
Explore entrepreneurship opportunities in the culinary industry.
Research and present information on a design career to include roles and responsibilities, employment opportunities, and education and training requirements.

Research and present information on an audio visual technology, film, and printing technology career to include roles and responsibilities, employment opportunities and education and training requirements.
Research and present information on careers in education to include the roles and responsibilities, opportunities for employment, and requirements for training and certification.
Research and present information on a culinary career to include roles and responsibilities, opportunities for employment, and education and training requirements.
Apply leadership and communication skills.
Define leadership and different leadership styles.
Define communication and identify methods of communication.
Identify the Career and Technical Student Organization(s) that are appropriate for CTE programs in each of the career clusters.
Discuss the establishment and history of the Distributive Education Clubs of America (DECA) organization.
Discuss the establishment and history of the Family, Career and Community Leaders of America (FCCLA) organization.
Discuss the establishment and history of the Florida Public Service Association (FPSA) organization.
Discuss the establishment and history of the Florida Technical Student Association (FL-TSA) organization.
Discuss the establishment and history of the Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA) and Business Professionals of America (BPA) organizations.
Discuss the establishment and history of the Future Farmers of America (FFA) organization.
Discuss the establishment and history of the Health Occupations Students of America (HOSA) organization.
Discuss the establishment and history of the SkillsUSA organization.
Describe the aims and purposes of the Future Farmers of America (FFA) organization.
Identify opportunities available to Future Farmers of America (FFA) members.
Identify the characteristics and responsibilities of organizational leaders.
Identify characteristics of a good leader.
Describe the leadership opportunities available to members of the Career and Technical Student Organization(s) for the career cluster.
Investigate the Career and Technical Student Organization(s) for the career cluster at your school or in your school district (e.g. membership requirements, dues, activities, events).
Demonstrate parliamentary procedure skills during a meeting.
Participate on a committee which has an assigned task and report to the class.
Demonstrate effective communication skills through delivery of a speech, presentation, or demonstration.
Use a computer to assist in the completion of a project related to the career cluster.
Analyze the characteristics and responsibilities of organizational leaders.
Evaluate a committee which has an assigned task and report to the class.
Participate in a cooperative leadership development activity or Future Farmers of America (FFA) Career Development Event.
Identify the importance of effective communication skills.
Identify state and community organizations associated with agricultural promotion.
Identify communication skills necessary for effective leadership.
Increase awareness of leadership opportunities through professional organizations such as Career Technical Student Organizations (CTSOs).
Demonstrate an understanding of how information technology is used in the related field.
Demonstrate basic communication skills.
Demonstrate the ability to follow written and oral directions.
Demonstrate examples of verbal and non-verbal communication.
Recognize the role and use of terminology and abbreviations used in various health occupations.
Recognize the role and use of basic terminology and abbreviations used in nursing.
Identify work values and goal setting tools.
Explain how values are acquired and changed.
Explain how values affect work.
Identify goal setting tools including a self-inventory and interest survey.
Demonstrate team player skills.
Define teamwork.
Identify the benefits of working cooperatively.
Recognize confrontational personality types within a team.
Practice conflict resolution techniques.
Select and use tools and equipment.
Identify and select the appropriate tool for the assignment.
Demonstrate the proper and safe use of tools and equipment.
Demonstrate care and maintenance of tools and equipment.
Demonstrate effective customer service skills.
Practice appropriate communication skills when dealing with customers in person and over the phone (i.e. telephone etiquette, courtesy, and manners).
Identify and evaluate customer needs.
Practice responding to client inquiries in a timely manner.
Practice techniques to effectively serve customers.
Practice assisting clients, including difficult customers, with problem resolution.
Demonstrate employability skills.
Identify personal talents and abilities that can contribute to positive self-esteem and success in the workplace.
Identify skills needed for employment as a nurse.
Identify academic skills required for job success.
Identify and practice teamwork skills.

At a minimum, demonstrate the skills used within nursing from the following list: basic first aid and CPR; patient menu planning and feeding techniques; measure and record temperature, pulse and respiration (TPR); use of wheelchairs, crutches and walkers; perform a weight, height and BMI assessment; graph the development of an infant or child on a growth chart; correctly perform making an occupied and unoccupied bed.
Recognize factors that may influence career choices.
Identify and practice employability skills.
Identify sources of career information.
Practice positive work ethics and identify negative work ethics that can contribute to success in the workplace.
Exhibit work expectations of the food service employer.
List the steps in a job search.
Identify the work-related expectations of an employer-employee relationship.
Demonstrate effective interviewing skills.
Apply math, reading, science, and critical thinking skills as they relate to industry.
Identify existing family and consumer sciences career pathways within the school system.
Demonstrate the ability to complete a job application.
Create and discuss the importance of the components of a current resume.
Create and maintain an employment portfolio.
Identify the components of a portfolio.
Discuss the value of a career portfolio.
Prepare a computer-generated portfolio.
Maintain the portfolio components in a professionally organized format.
Demonstrate computer literacy.

Define computer related terms (computer, data input, output, hardware, software, language, processing, memory, program, terminal, peripheral devices, keyboard characters, virtual reality, three-dimensional devices).
Operate a computer using online platforms and applications.
Identify the advantages and disadvantages of the use of different computer formats and operating systems.
Describe some general uses of computers, smart phones and tablets.
Identify the safety precautions that must be observed in using computer equipment.
Explain some of the legal and ethical issues involved in using a computer and online or social media.
Use the Internet to explore selected occupations.
Develop leadership and interpersonal problem-solving skills through participation in co-curricular activities.
Demonstrate effective communication skills.
Participate in teamwork to accomplish specified organizational goals.
Demonstrate cooperation and understanding with persons who are ethnically and culturally diverse.
Demonstrate good work habits and career planning.
Identify attitudes and habits necessary to achieve career success.
Describe personality aspects to consider when choosing a career.
Identify the basic steps in career planning.
Identify and research careers within a specific area of agriscience.
Develop a basic career plan.
Identify and research careers within a specific area of government or public administration.
Identify and research careers within a specific area of human services.
Integrate the use of science, mathematics, reading, geography, history, writing, and communication.
Apply basic mathematics operations to solve problems.
Correctly use measuring devices and utilize measurements to solve problems.
Prepare written and oral materials using correct English grammar.
Identify the main idea in oral presentations and written materials.
Locate, organize, and interpret information from a variety of sources.
Select and study a problem that can be tested under controlled conditions to establish a hypothesis or to illustrate a known law.
Apply the scientific method to solve a problem.
Identify specific areas of commodity production in the state, nation, and world.
Describe the historical evolution of agriculture.
Describe the historical evolution of agriculture in Florida.
Describe the historical evolution of government and public administration.
Demonstrate the skills involved in effective resource management.
Identify the steps of the decision-making process.
Distinguish between a need and a want.
Explain how values and goals affect decisions.
Develop a budget and savings plan.
Analyze the relationship between resources and the attainment of lifestyle goals.
Define resources.
List the benefits of managing resources.
Prepare and keep a daily planner.
Describe qualities and characteristics of a positive mentoring experience.
Develop a self-improvement plan using the decision-making process to set goals and priorities.
Apply the decision-making process to personal, social, and family activities.
Identify factors that affect consumer choices.
Identify ways to manage your resources for personal needs and wants.
Discuss reasons for working.
Identify the personal skills needed for employment.
Discuss careers related to resource management.
Explain the relationship between income and lifestyle.
Practice employee and job safety.
Discuss the roles of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).
Discuss human errors and unsafe work environments and their relationship to employee safety.
Demonstrate safe operation of workplace equipment.
Identify first aid procedures for accidents and injuries.
Exhibit positive human relations and leadership skills.
Perform roles in a student personnel system or in a career and technical student organization (CTSO).
Work cooperatively with others.
Perform roles in a student personnel system or in the Florida Technology Student Association (FL-TSA).
Discuss individual interests, aptitudes, and opportunities as they relate to a career.
Describe individual strengths and weaknesses.
Identify individual strengths and weaknesses.
Discuss individual interests related to a career.
Identify careers within specific areas of technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in communication technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in production technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in transportation technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and employment opportunities in power energy technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in engineering  technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in robotics technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in technical design technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in electronics technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in maritime technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in logistics and supply chain technology.
List occupations, job requirements, and job opportunities in green construction and architectural technology.
Explore careers within specific areas of interest.
List academic and career programs at the secondary level in communication technology.
List occupational training programs and academic programs at the secondary and postsecondary levels in production technology.
List occupational training programs and academic programs at the secondary and postsecondary levels in transportation technology.
List occupational training programs and academic programs available at the secondary and postsecondary levels in power and energy technologies.
List academic and career programs at the secondary levels in engineering technology.
List academic and career programs at the secondary levels in robotics technology.
List academic and career programs at the secondary levels in technical design technology.
List academic and career programs at the secondary levels in electronics technology.

List academic and career programs at the secondary levels in logistics and supply chain technology.

Form an understanding and appreciation for work after listening to or observing technology workers.
Form an understanding and appreciation for work after participating in a simulated technology group project in the laboratory.
Form an understanding and appreciation for the roles and work of technology workers.
Form an understanding and appreciation for the roles and work of co-workers.
Technology
Use information technology tools.
Identify the functions of web browsers, and use them to access the world wide web and other computer resources typically used in the career cluster.
Use email clients to send simple messages and files to other internet users.
Demonstrate ways to communicate effectively using internet technology.
Use different types of web search engines effectively to locate information relevant to the career cluster.
Describe and use communication features of information technology.
Define important internet communications protocols and their roles in delivering basic internet services.
Identify basic principles of the Domain Name System (DNS).
Identify security issues related to internet clients.
Identify and use principles of Personal Information Management (PIM), including common applications.
Efficiently transmit text and attachments using popular internet services, including email.
Conduct a webcast and related services.
Represent technical issues to a non-technical audience.
Classify common file extensions based on software application programs used in the workplace environment.
Identify and demonstrate various ways to communicate effectively using internet technology.
Identify and categorize usage of different forms of storage devices and backup media.
Recognize essential database concepts.
Identify and describe types of file systems.
Identify roles and responsibilities of members of professional organizations, community service organizations, and career and technical student organizations.
Work cooperatively as a group member to achieve organizational goals.
Demonstrate leadership roles and organizational responsibilities.
Identify and utilize the planning process.
Identify components of network systems.
Identify basic hardware and software components needed to access the Internet.
Identify user customization features in web browsers.
Recognize essential database concepts.
Define and use networking and internet services.
Define database and identify how it is used in the business environment.
Identify attitudes and habits necessary to achieve career success.
Describe how information technology is used in the career cluster.
Identify through internet research the responsibilities, tasks, and skills required for information technology careers in the career cluster.
Identify security-related ethical and legal information technology issues faced by professionals in the career cluster.
Relate information technology project management concepts and terms to careers in the career cluster.
Manage information technology components typically used in professions of the career cluster.

Identify information technology careers in the Law, Public Safety and Security career cluster, including the responsibilities, tasks and skills they require to include: NCIC/FCIC, CAD System in Dispatch, Computer Forensics, and Encryption.
Research information technology careers for a presentation.

Identify security-related ethical and legal information technology issues faced by professionals in the Law, Public Safety and Security career cluster to include: confidentiality and personal information (personal computer use).
